channel.title: Changing starting bank?
channel.description:
i making f2p server that you have alot of shit in your bank when you start. let's say i want 999999999 of object 995 in the bank of a new account... how do i do this?
-i been trying to find it in player.java but i dont know where it is-

item.title: Changing starting bank?
item.dc:creator: @Olzax Olzax
item.description:
@Olzax wrote:

yea i got it to work thanks… now to repeat about 100 times =/

Read full topic

item.title: Changing starting bank?
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

thats is what you got to do but make a new acc then look in bank when i did it filled the bank with 999m cash lol but np and i am always happy to help

Read full topic

item.title: Changing starting bank?
item.dc:creator: @Olzax Olzax
item.description:
@Olzax wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:2, topic:230988”]ok umm u mite wanna try look for this bankItemsN[i] = 0;

then do somthing like this… bankItemsN[i] = 9999999999; but right before u see this for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { // Setting bank items
bankItems[i] = 996;
}
or somthing like thats the item id but before u even use i just saying carefull… it will load your bank with items well… it did with me
when u r done it should look like this
for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { // Setting bank items
bankItems[i] = 996;
}

    for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { // Setting bank item amounts
        bankItemsN[i] = 9999999999;
    }

only thing is i tried what u want to do… was not wat i was thinking it does work tho[/quote]
thanks! -dosn’t seem like it’s working… ill mess aroud with it till i get it right

Read full topic

item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

ok umm u mite wanna try look for this bankItemsN[i] = 0;

then do somthing like this… bankItemsN[i] = 9999999999; but right before u see this for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { // Setting bank items
bankItems[i] = 996;
}
or somthing like thats the item id but before u even use i just saying carefull… it will load your bank with items well… it did with me
when u r done it should look like this
for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { // Setting bank items
bankItems[i] = 996;
}

    for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { // Setting bank item amounts
        bankItemsN[i] = 9999999999;
    }

only thing is i tried what u want to do… was not wat i was thinking it does work tho
